results.title: RMIT AIM Collection 1994
results.brief_description:
Compilation of student work from the University of RMIT Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) Department. 1994.
The Centre for Animation and Interactive Media, its courses, facilities, staff and collection of work was transferred from Swinburne University of Technology to RMIT University in 1995.

results.title: [The Fridge]
results.brief_description: An ant attempts to climb to the top of the family fridge. As he scales towards the summit - dressed in his mountain climbing gear - an accident prevents him from achieving his goal. His tragic downfall is captured by photographers.
results.description: An ant attempts to climb to the top of the family fridge. As he scales towards the summit - dressed in his mountain climbing gear - an accident prevents him from achieving his goal. His tragic downfall is captured by photographers.

results.title: Yborn
results.brief_description: A range of animation techniques are employed to explore the cycle of life and death. The tranquility of life in the womb, disrupted by birth and the demands of society is finally restored.

results.title: Whale bait
results.brief_description: A whale’s strategy for dealing with fishing fleets and scientific research. The film makes a simple and effective statement on the struggle between man and nature.

results.title: Vinaigrette
results.brief_description: Tribute to Melbourne’s ‘Skipping Girl’ and other historical landmarks. Leaving her neon home, the ‘Skipping Girl’ boards a tram bound for the city where she swaps her frock for a bodysuit. She spends the night clubbing, visiting Luna Park and enjoying the nightlife before her freedom and adventure come to an end as she returns home just before the ‘Nylex’ clock stikes midnight.

results.title: Tram
results.brief_description: Itâ€™s been a long day. Its hot, you’re tired, you feel like a sardine stuffed into a tin can and you just want to get home. The tram conductor from hell is not helping matters. The strangest things happen on public transport.
